data.enText: seeming or stated to be real or true, when this is perhaps not the case
The ostensible reason for his absence was illness.
Troops were sent in, ostensibly to protect the civilian population.
data.chText: 谎称为保护平民而派驻了军队。

example: His ostensible purpose was charity, his real goal popularity

tr: appearing as such but not necessarily so
example: for all his apparent wealth he had no money to pay the rent
the committee investigated some apparent discrepancies
the ostensible truth of their theories

example.ex: The ostensible purpose of these meetings was to gather information on financial strategies.
example.tran: 这些会议声称旨在收集有关金融策略的信息。

value.def: Ostensible is used to describe something that seems to be true or is officially stated to be true, but about which you or other people have doubts.
value.tran: 表面上的；貌似真实的；宣称的

example.ex: A bachelor farmer began to call, ostensibly to talk to her father, but really to see her.
example.tran: 一位单身农场主开始前来拜访，嘴上说是找她的父亲，实际上是想见她。
